items.title: Data Pipeline Developer for the Democratic Commons at mySociety (London, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent

Job description

mySociety is looking for an experienced developer with Ruby skills to work on our Democratic Commons project: a concept of open and shared democratic data where anyone can contribute, and anyone can benefit. We’re creating the core infrastructure, tools and data that will kickstart the Democratic Commons because we believe that the data that allow people to hold their own governments to account should be freely available to all.

This is a fast-moving project with an ambitious timeline for the next year, so we’re looking for someone who can hit the ground running and will thrive in a dynamic environment. We’ll be working with a varied range of partners around the world; from volunteers and small NGOs to deep established engagements with Wikidata and Facebook.

To be a good fit, you will be comfortable working with partners both big and small, listening to their needs and helping to translate those into plans, tickets and concrete features that you can implement. You’ll come with the ability to discuss and explain technical concepts to non-expert stakeholders and will enjoy working on a variety of different kinds of problems, while thinking about the bigger picture.


No recruiters or agencies, please.

Key responsibilities

You will be:

  • Working within a small but growing development team to design, build and maintain a large-scale distributed architecture for sourcing and updating basic political information and making it freely available
  • Developing the infrastructure that will allow the team to deliver datasets for countries at an escalating pace through the first year of the project
  • Creating scrapers and tools that enable partners around the world to populate and correct data
  • Communicating with partners to iterate and improve the tools and ensure they are fit for purpose for different levels of capability
  • Contributing to a team culture of agile innovation focused on creative and responsive solutions to the challenges of a project with a growing scale

About mySociety

Since 2003 mySociety have built and grown a series of democratic and civic websites and apps, including FixMyStreet.com, WhatDoTheyKnow.com, WriteToThem.com and TheyWorkForYou.com which are used by more than 10 million people each year. Whilst we continue to run our sites in the UK, we also help groups in over 40 other countries to establish and make a success of their own, similar sites.

Our charitable work is made possible by major grants from funders such as the Omidyar Network, the Hewlett Foundation, and Google, who support our desire to share software, knowledge and good practice for the benefit of the global Civic Technology community. We work across three thematic areas, developing online services in Freedom of Information, Democracy and Better Cities.

Our growing research team aims to establish how, whether and when Civic Technology can make a difference, and share these learnings widely with civil society and governments. Our project management style aims to minimise pain and distraction, and leave people to get on with doing great work, normally in small teams.

Our commercial subsidiary mySociety Ltd delivers off-the-shelf services for local authority and other clients in the UK and abroad, along with commercial access to our data services and custom development work and consultancy. Its profits are reinvested into the work of the charity.


Deadlines and dates

The application deadline is 10am GMT on Friday 15th December and interviews will take place the first week of January 2018. We will aim to notify applicants of whether or not they will be invited to interview by Friday 22nd December.

Application instructions

Your application should consist of a CV and covering statement.

Use your covering letter to show us why your skills make you a good fit for this role. We’re also going to want to see some samples of work that best represent you, so if you have examples online, let us know where to find them.


Benefits


Salary is in the range of £43,000 to £52,000 depending on experience, plus pension (3% employer contribution, 5% employee). This is a one year fixed-term contract.

We expect you to be based in the UK and you need to have the right to work in this country (sorry, but we can’t offer help with visas or relocation expenses).

mySociety is an adaptable, understanding employer and we have some great benefits including 25 days off per year (plus bank holidays), a new laptop, flexible working patterns, a yearly annual retreat and regular company meetups in cities up and down the country. Read more at www.mysociety.org/careers.

We welcome people who are committed to making a difference, but we take work life balance very seriously and we celebrate the idea of quality, not quantity of working hours: if you work more than your contracted hours then we insist on time off in lieu to compensate.

Most of our staff work remotely whilst still seeing each other face to face as often as we can. We work from home, co-working spaces, or small offices. We have small clusters of people around Bristol and London and would particularly like to hear from people based near those cities, but will accept applicants from anywhere in the United Kingdom. We ask that you are willing to travel to other parts of the country to see colleagues and clients perhaps a dozen times a year. You can read more about what it’s like working at mySociety at https://www.mysociety.org/about/careers/culture/.

About mySociety

mySociety is a not-for-profit social enterprise, based in the UK and working internationally. We make websites and tools that empower citizens… like WriteToThem, FixMyStreet, WhatDoTheyKnow, TheyWorkForYou, and Alaveteli.


You can read more about why you might want to work for us on our careers page, or sign up to our jobs mailing list to hear about new positions.


Got questions? Ask us anything.

items.title: Data Scientist
items.content:
*Data Scientist*
Do you want to join an exciting early stage start-up into the intelligent event technology space? Do you dream about building and growing the data science function of our product? Are you motivated by working in a fast-paced dynamic environment? We’re looking for a mid-level Data Scientist to join our team based in London (with some remote work possible). This is a 6-month project initially with scope to become a permanent role after that.

*Must Haves*

* Strong mathematical skills
* Strong applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression
* Core Data Science skills
* Ability to learn quickly
* Practical experience of Python
* Ability to suggest ideas, test them and iterate on them
* At least 2 years commercial experience
* Excellent English language communication, in particular the ability to explain complex analytical ideas to non experts


*Nice to Haves*

* Knowledge of core Python data science libraries such as SciPy, numpy, Pandas, Plotly etc
* Good understanding of graph theory
* The ability to suggest, design and build static visualisations and other outputs that can be used by customers
* Experience with Jupyter notebooks
* Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques
* Experience with signal processing
* Experience with solving geolocation based problems

*Culture and Personality*

* Willing to work hard but also have fun
* Good sense of humour
* Entrepreneurial spirit
* An appetite to achieve great things

*About Hiver*

Hiver provides intelligent networking technology designed to improve event-goer's experience and engagement at events by enhancing the way attendees interact with each other. Hiver solves the issue of name forgetting at events - which 80% of event goers report experiencing. As users interact, anonymous data from these improved interactions is presented to the event organiser so they can better understand the composition and quality of the event, giving them the tools to improve event by event as well as quantitatively market the engagement of their event over other conferences.Hiver was a part of London Business School and Deloitte Incubator and of Google Best in British Campus Exchange as is now a member of the Entrepreneurial Spark London Hub.

Learn more at www.hivertech.com

No agencies please.

items.title: Google Earth Enterprise (GEE) Open Source Developer at Thermopylae Sciences and Technology () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Information Technology
Company size: 51-200 people

Job description

Google Earth Enterprise (GEE) Open Source Developer

Location:  Remote (Work from Home) or Arlington, VA

Do you want to work on a product that allows government organizations and businesses to host their own Google Earth Globe?  Open Google Earth Enterprise (Open GEE) allows organizations and businesses to take advantage of the same publicly available Google Earth capabilities, behind the firewall, in an offline/disconnected environment, or in low bandwidth regions.  By joining the Thermopylae team you’ll be able to help continue to lead Google Earth Enterprise as open source.  After almost two years of updates, primarily maintenance fixes, Google and Thermopylae have worked to open-source the Google Earth Enterprise product, consisting of GEE Fusion, GEE Server, and GEE Portable.  TST is now at the forefront of maintaining and enhancing Open GEE for the GIS community.  Check us out at:

Project Site
http://www.opengee.org/
 
GitHub Site
https://github.com/google/earthenterprise/
 
Job Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Math
  • 4+ years Linux C++ app dev and debugging experience (gdb, 64 bit app builds, etc.)
  • Python app dev and debugging experience
  • Familiarity with web technologies (HTTPS, SSL, Javascript, etc.)


Additional experience desired

  • Experience with geospatial and/or mapping technologies
  • Knowledge/experience with the following products:
    • GDAL
    • PostgreSQL/PostGIS
    • Qt user interfaces in C++
    • Apache Webserver
    • Scons build system
  • Experience deploying and supporting end-user open-source Linux software base to a large user base
  • Experience debugging multi-threaded applications/concurrency issues
  • Cross-platform C++ app dev and debugging experience
  • Qt experience
  • Pulse experience / Python s-conscript


Job Duties

  • Expected to deliver new features, enhancements, and fixes into Git SCMs
  • Expected to write unit tests, integration tests, and smoke tests
  • Ownership of end-to-end delivery of software.  The team owns the DevOps.

About Thermopylae Sciences and Technology

Thermopylae Sciences and Technology (pronounced "ther-mop-uh-lee") was founded in 2007. At Thermopylae, we focus on excellence in all we do. We particularly excel in Web-based geospatial capabilities, mobile software framework and applications, situational awareness, and cloud computing.

Benefits

Comprehensive Leave
Holidays
401(k) Savings Plan/ Profit-Sharing
Health and Dental Insurance
Relocation Benefits
Short-Term Disability Long-Term Disability Life Insurance
Family, Medical, Bereavement, Civic Duty, and Personal Leave

items.title: Software Data Engineer (Python/Flask) at hatch IT (Bethesda, MD) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: IT Recruitment
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Overview:
If you are a data minded software engineer and are looking to make an impact in the Healthcare Industry, we have the job for you! Hatch is currently working with Aledade, a Healthcare IT startup based in Bethesda, MD that provides everything a doctor needs to create and run an accountable care organization (ACO) - from business practice transformation services to upfront capital and cutting-edge technology platform. They are currently looking to add multiple Software Engineers to the team, with the opportunity to work remotely, to help enhance their data driven application. You would be working on their core architecture team, working extensively with Python & SQL, to help bring innovation to the healthcare arena. This team is currently compromised of 6 experienced Python engineers 

Company Tech Stack: Angular/Python/Flask/Postgres/AWS
 
Does this describe you?

  • Thrive in the fast-moving, hard-charging environment of an early-stage startup.
  • Have 2+ years experience with Python & SQL 
  • Passion and proven track record for creating robust, scalable web applications
  • Desire to develop products that positively impact peoples healthcare

If you are interested in learning more about this company or any Startups/Small Businesses in the area, please contact us!!
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About hatch IT

hatch IT is a boutique software development recruiting firm headquartered in the Washington, DC metro area. We’re a company on a mission to help bridge the gap between DC based technology startups, small-businesses and the local software engineering community. 

hatch is a candidate-centric recruiting partner who places an emphasis on ensuring the introduction between every candidate and company is harmonious. We take into account the scope of work, technology stack, culture & career path with every engagement. Long term talent retention is a top priority with startups & small businesses, and our team is proud to have a successful track-record in helping developers find their dream job and small companies identify the talent they need to thrive.

Benefits

Medical Insurance
Unlimited PTO
Telecommute flexibility
Monthly Happy Hours
Flexible Work Hours
Annual Company Vacations
Competitive Compensation

items.title: Doximity | Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Software Engineer, DevOps Engineer | San Francisco | REMOTE & ONSITE, FULL-TIME ...
items.content:
Doximity | Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Software Engineer, DevOps Engineer | San Francisco | REMOTE & ONSITE, FULL-TIME | Salary $100k+ & Equity | https://work.doximity.com

We're helping doctors communicate more effectively to enhance the quality of care. Doximity is the largest professional network of Healthcare professionals with adoption by over 75% of all U.S. Clinicians. Started in 2011, we've raised $82MM from DFJ, Emergence, and Morgenthaler Ventures. Our R&D team is about 120 people roughly 50% of which is fully distributed. We have one of the richest healthcare data sets ever compiled.

  Tech Stack: Web: Ruby, Rails, Vuejs, Go, iOS, Android   Data Stack: Redshift, Kafka, Spark, Python, Airflow, Neo4j  DevOps Stack: AWS, Terraform, Chef, Nginx
We are looking for Full-stack software engineers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and DevOps Engineers to help build, maintain, and continue to scale our current infrastructure. I am the VP, Engineering at Doximity and have been with the company for almost 7 years.

Reach out directly (brunomiranda@doximity.com) if you are interested in any of the Data Science and Engineering roles listed here https://work.doximity.com/positions/

Remote positions within the U.S. and Canada only.

items.title: Senior QA (hiptest, nightwatchjs, selenium, gherkin, manual) at FineTune Learning (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Assessment, Education Technology, Human Resources
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

FineTune is seeking a senior QA for our AP and Pre-AP software product.   We are a fully distributed and international team though 1/3 of us are in Boston Metro area.  S/he will have the opportunity to work on mission critical software that will impact 3-5 million students in 2019.  If you are well versed in various selenium based testing, load testing, smoke testing, test driven development and have worked in QA'ing at least 3 production released software, you are welcome to apply. S/he will be working with our development team, product owners, designers and increase the quality of the software so that we may serve 3 million+ users in 2019.

Requirements:

  • Proven experience in understanding complex user needs with multiple stakeholders
  • 5+ years of QA experience
  • 3+ years experience with API testing, UI testing, end to end testing.
  • 3+ years experience QA’ing high-availability enterprise software a plus
  • 3+ years experience with Databases (SQL or noSQL)
  • Experience with Selenium
  • Strong Agile Experience
  • Experience with continuous integration and test driven development
  • Ability to dive deep into technical issues.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience in debugging performance issues with javascript and reactjs or other SPA architecture a plus
  • Experience with collaborating in github a plus
  • Desire to continuously, learn, improve and apply new technologies that will increase operational efficiency and effectiveness
  • BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent a plus

As we prepare for rapid business growth from here, FineTune Learning is seeking to hire a Senior QA Engineer who have worked in at least 2-3 production released software/web/mobile products.  We are looking for people who have strong motivation to grow startup companies, who is agile and continuously improving themselves while having an opinion for great software components and services with great attention to detail in delivering reliable software that is well tested according to user expectations.

About FineTune Learning

We are working on a variety of projects from componentizing and enhancing front end reactjs to optimize user experience and reusability of components.  We are constantly collecting data on users to help recommend better resources for their learning.  We build interesting but simple dashboards that may help teachers become more data driven.  We work on behavioral experiments via randomized control trial through our software. Our backend is mostly python/sqlalchemy and supports graphql and diverse set of databases depending on the application.  Continuous integration and continuous deployment are next in our pipeline. We are facing challenges in scalability and automation which we plan to tackle in 2018 and refactor code to increase the software performance and support 5 million users.  We work with our design team to make this experience engaging for effective learning. We practice agile and scrum and strive to continuously improve.

Benefits

Responsible time off
100% remote work/work from anywhere
401k
Health/dental
Profit sharing

items.title: Go Agent Engineer - APM - Elasticsearch at Elastic () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

Innovation at Elastic never stops and we are excited to have recently been joined by the amazing team from Opbeat who are currently working hard to fully integrate their Application Performance Monitoring solution into the Elastic Stack. Welcome Elastic APM! We are currently making major changes to the product as we integrate it with the Elastic Stack, and we are now looking for a talented Go Engineer to join the team as soon as possible.

As our first Go agent engineer on the APM team, you will be owning the exciting efforts of adding Go support to APM. Your primary task will be to develop our open source Go agent, take ownership for the feature roadmap, ensuring that the resource footprint is minimal. You will also be engaging with the open source Go community.

You will also collaborate closely with the APM Server team when adding new features to the server API and with the UI team to ensure that we deliver the best possible experience for Go developers.

You will become part of a team developing a high quality APM product aimed to help fellow developers successfully and expertly instrument, debug, and monitor their applications.

What you will be doing

  • Work on a completely new and exciting Elastic project
  • Develop and be responsible for the Go agent for Elastic APM
  • The agent is open-source, so the job includes handling community pull requests, issues, etc
  • Collaborate with your fellow Engineers on APM Server and UI teams

What you will bring along

  • 3+ years of professional and in-depth experience with Go
  • Previous APM experience is considered a big asset
  • Ability to work independently in a globally distributed team

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits
  • Option to work 100% remote or from any office
  • Stock options
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Employees with a wide variety of interests
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
  • Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages! Some even fly south for the winter :)

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

About Elastic

Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since its initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, The New York Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 400 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits
  • Stock options
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Employees with a wide variety of interests
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Benefits

401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
Health Care Insurance
Vacation Time Determined By Location
Lunch and Breakfast in Most Offices
100% Remote work possible

items.title: Senior Distributed Database Engineer at Stardog Union (Arlington, VA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Databases, Enterprise Software, Information Technology
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Stardog is the world's leading Knowledge Graph platform for the Enterprise. Turn data into knowledge faster and easier. Stardog lets you query, search, and analyze enterprise data, wherever it is, using scalable, cutting-edge Knowledge Graph technology.

The future has always been distributed and the future is arriving now. If you know that Raft isn't just a flotation device, then you could be a great fit for Stardog.

Responsibilities:

  • Help design and build storage and query evaluation over a large distributed database
  • Develop and implement algorithms for distributed transactions over very large clusters
  • Implement and optimize graph algorithms over distributed indexes 
  • Work on integration with DCOS frameworks like Mesos

Skills & Requirements

  • 5+ years programming experience, ideally in Java
  • Strong computer science fundamentals, with advanced knowledge of data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Experience building distributed databases and service-oriented architectures
  • Knowledge of Spark, Storm, Flink, DCOS frameworks like Mesos
  • Ability to work in a distributed team mainly communicating over email, chat, and phone
  • Experience with graph technologies or databases is a plus

About Stardog Union

Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Benefits

Health care including dental & vision, some plans fully company paid
401k
3 weeks vacation
Remote work available for qualified candidates
Top of the line hardware
Flexible work schedule
Company paid life and disability benefits
Well stocked kitchen, snacks, lunch, and most importantly, coffee

items.title: Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe
items.content:
Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe - Jobmote

Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe

Real Audience

Real Audience is a Swedish tech company within the Artificial Intelligence / Big Data field, focusing on collecting and storing specific site data, do calculations on the data and help our customers to take actions based on the computed predictions.

Now we are looking to strengthen our remote team with a talented data scientist. Your responsibilities will be to develop and maintain the algorithms that are being used for data processing throughout the system. In addition you will do ad-hoc data analysis, anomaly detection, track performance and contribute to the overall development of our products.

We write functional code in Clojure/Scala, but Java and working JVM knowledge is a great foundation - we will leave room for you to develop skills in the languages that are new to you. As we try to get the team to meet from time to time, we look for people that live in Central or Eastern European countries.

You should have a sense for:

  • selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
  • data mining using state-of-the-art methods

  • taking care of company’s data including addition of third party sources of information, enhancing data collection procedures, processing and verifying the integrity of data

  • working with agile methodology, such as Scrum

  • working from home in a remote team

Ideally, you should have:

  • an excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms
  • experience with common data science toolkits and data visualisation tools
  • good understanding of Clojure/Scala/Java development and JVM
  • a university degree in math, technology, science or other relevant areas
  • impressive statistics and programming skills
  • knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Amazon AWS
  • experience with data modelling using CQL/SQL query languages
  • an interest in high software quality
  • at least five years of professional background

Additionally, you:

  • seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our customers
  • inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with
  • are a passionate data scientist with data-oriented personality, proud of the quality of your work
  • are an independent worker and self-starter, as the job is fully remote
  • have great communication skills in spoken and written English
  • are willing to travel to Sweden, Poland, Norway or other European countries for occasional in person meetings with the team
  • live in Europe (for example Poland, Bulgaria, Ukraine, Croatia, Portugal etc.), where we currently have developers

Bonus points for:

  • an interesting Github profile, or proven track record of open source contributions

We offer:

  • an amazing opportunity to work with, and create cutting edge technology within the area of machine learning and artificial intelligence!
  • work in the Amazon AWS environment with a modern technology stack, such as Cassandra, Spark, Kafka, ElasticSearch
  • no technical dept
  • stable company with a Scandinavian client base, with the intent to expand to the rest of the world
  • a great and experienced remote team
  • a permanent full time contract, with a fixed monthly payment (on invoice)
  • salary range €3000 - €5000

items.title: Real Audience: Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe
items.content:
Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe

Posted Nov 16

Real Audience
Headquarters: Stockholm, Sweden
http://realaudience.se

Real Audience is a Swedish tech company within the Artificial Intelligence / Big Data field, focusing on collecting and storing specific site data, do calculations on the data and help our customers to take actions based on the computed predictions.

Now we are looking to strengthen our remote team with a talented data scientist. Your responsibilities will be to develop and maintain the algorithms that are being used for data processing throughout the system. In addition you will do ad-hoc data analysis, anomaly detection, track performance and contribute to the overall development of our products.

We write functional code in Clojure/Scala, but Java and working JVM knowledge is a great foundation - we will leave room for you to develop skills in the languages that are new to you. As we try to get the team to meet from time to time, we look for people that live in Central or Eastern European countries.

You should have a sense for:
  • selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
  • data mining using state-of-the-art methods
  • taking care of company’s data including addition of third party sources of information, enhancing data collection procedures, processing and verifying the integrity of data
  • working with agile methodology, such as Scrum
  • working from home in a remote team

Ideally, you should have:
  • an excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms
  • experience with common data science toolkits and data visualisation tools
  • good understanding of Clojure/Scala/Java development and JVM
  • a university degree in math, technology, science or other relevant areas
  • impressive statistics and programming skills
  • knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Amazon AWS
  • experience with data modelling using CQL/SQL query languages
  • an interest in high software quality
  • at least five years of professional background

Additionally, you:
  • seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our customers
  • inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with
  • are a passionate data scientist with data-oriented personality, proud of the quality of your work
  • are an independent worker and self-starter, as the job is fully remote
  • have great communication skills in spoken and written English
  • are willing to travel to Sweden, Poland, Norway or other European countries for occasional in person meetings with the team
  • live in Europe (for example Poland, Bulgaria, Ukraine, Croatia, Portugal etc.), where we currently have developers

Bonus points for:
  • an interesting Github profile, or proven track record of open source contributions

We offer:
  • an amazing opportunity to work with, and create cutting edge technology within the area of machine learning and artificial intelligence!
  • work in the Amazon AWS environment with a modern technology stack, such as Cassandra, Spark, Kafka, ElasticSearch
  • no technical dept
  • stable company with a Scandinavian client base, with the intent to expand to the rest of the world
  • a great and experienced remote team
  • a permanent full time contract, with a fixed monthly payment (on invoice)
  • salary range €3000 - €5000

Apply for this position

Please send your application together with CV and relevant links (open source contributions, Github/Stack Overflow accounts, public projects, code samples etc.) to Real Audience AB. Please also state clearly in which country you reside and will work from. Email address for applications: datascientist2017@realaudience.se

items.title: Stanson Health: Data Analyst
items.content:
Data Analyst

Posted Nov 14

Stanson Health
Headquarters: Los Angeles, CA
https://www.stansonhealth.com/

This position is full time, fully remote, and for legal US residents only.

We are not interested in recruiters or software consultancies.

Stanson Health is a healthcare technology company in Los Angeles, CA specializing in clinical decision support. We are trying to help healthcare providers deliver better care by giving them timely, relevant guidance. We believe that good decision support can lower costs, improve care, and ultimately save lives.

Our Data Science group is searching for a Data Analyst to work on deriving insights from our various data sources and turning them into new product features. This is a unique opportunity for someone who enjoys detailed quantitative analysis and creative collaborations with clinicians and engineers to advance our healthcare intelligence platform.

We are looking for a candidate who is versed in writing code to gather and analyze large amounts of data and comfortable in communicating the findings in verbal and written form.

Requirements
  • Strong Python or R skills for collecting, manipulating, analyzing and visualizing data
  • Knowledge of the Python scientific and data libraries such as Pandas and Jupyter is preferred
  • Strong statistical knowledge
  • Experience with SQL databases
  • Strong analytic skills with special emphasis on experimental design and hypothesis testing
  • Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

Apply for this position

send a resume to data_science_jobs@stansonhealth.com

items.title: Data Application Engineer at Strong Analytics (Chicago, IL) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Industry: Big Data, Data Science, Machine Learning
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Strong Analytics is seeking an application and data engineer to collaborate with our team on developing machine learning and Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data pipelines, building RESTful APIs to trained statistical models, and deploying real-time streaming applications for continuous data processing.

This role is focused on applying and embedding machine learning solutions crafted by our team of PhD-trained data scientists. As such, it does not require deep expertise in machine learning or statistics, but rather a broad expertise in ingesting, storing, and analyzing data at scale.

To be eligible for this role, it is expected that you have experience:

  • Building and deploying Python applications to cloud-based infrastructures (e.g., AWS).
  • Writing complex SQL queries for a variety of data stores (e.g., Postgres, MySQL, Redshift).
  • Deploying (not necessarily designing/testing) machine learning pipelines and statistical models using one or more libraries, such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, or XGBoost.
  • Designing distributed applications that use workers and queues to manage asynchronous tasks.
  • Designing and building RESTful APIs.
  • Managing *nix servers via the terminal.
  • Managing and monitoring scheduled/batch jobs.
  • Writing unit tests.
  • Using continuous integration.
  • Collaborating via Git.

Ideally, you would also have experience (or an aptitude to learn about):

  • Building Apache Spark applications to analyze and learn from data at scale.
  • Building and deploying streaming applications (e.g., Spark Streaming, Akka Streams).
  • Deploying applications powered by Hadoop and/or other services provided by AWS EMR.

You do not need a PhD (or any formal education, for that matter) for this role. Applicants will be evaluated first-and-foremost on their experience and skill in the areas described above.

You should have the ability to travel infrequently (<5% of your time) for team meetups and conferences.

Remote or On-Site

This position offers 100% remote work for candidates outside the Chicago area with exceptional communication and remote collaboration skills. Candidates in the Chicago area who can work in-person with our team are preferred.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Profit sharing or equity, based on experience
  • Health insurance
  • Generous vacation policy
  • Flexible work-from-home policy
  • Company-issued MacBook Pro's

About Strong Analytics

We are a team of PhD-trained data scientists with expertise in machine learning, research and analytics, and deploying data-driven applications at scale.

We help organizations of all sizes — from new startups to Fortune 500 enterprise firms — tackle challenging analytics and machine learning projects. We help them frame their problems, design end-to-end solutions, and deploy/monitor analytics dashboards and machine learning pipelines that optimize their operations and help them build smarter products.

We are always working on new projects in a variety of industries, including the automotive, pharmaceutical, engineering, healthcare, SaaS, and consumer apps spaces. This leads to a fast-paced, learning-focused environment where we are always learning new things in collaboration with our team (and our clients' teams) in order to provide state-of-the-art solutions that work for our clients.

Benefits

Small, fun team of experts
Focus on continued learning, development, and growth
Generous vacation policy
Flexible work-from-home policy
Competitive salaries and health insurance benefits
Path to partnership through profit sharing and equity

items.title: Machine Learning Engineer f/m (100% Remote) at Jaumo GmbH (Göppingen, Germany) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Dating, Messaging, Social Networking
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We're looking for a new employee in our small five-person team and give you the opportunity to be part of a very exciting journey.

You are a Machine Learning Engineer (f/m) with strong experience, and you will be an essential part of our lean and focused company. The position is full-time. This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast growing 100% remote company in a key position.

You will:

  • provide our fastgrowing dating app used by millions of users on a monthly basis with an intelligent and personalized experience for finding a partner
  • solve challenging problems like online dating scam/fraud/fake prevention, automated moderation, optimizing matching algorithms and our recommendation system. 
  • introduce and scale a machine learning and data processing platform
  • take ownership of your codebase
  • be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment
  • work agile with a motivated and innovative small team (us, the two founders)

Skills & Requirements

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and has a professional experience with machine learning technologies. We admire engineers who take the initiative, make their own decisions and implement them precisely. 

Your qualifications:

  • at least 3 years of experience in software development, ideally in a high-performance web or mobile environment
  • solid experience in at least one of the following areas: machine learning, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, data mining or artificial intelligence
  • experience with one or more general purpose programming languages like Python, PHP, Java
  • you love getting things done you never give up, when it’s getting difficult. It’s a challenge to master every situation.
  • you speak and write business-fluent English

If this profile matches your expertise, experience, and aspirations, we’d be delighted to receive your full application, including salary requirements and possible starting date.

About Jaumo GmbH

Jaumo is one of the fastest growing dating apps worldwide with more than 30 million members in over 180 countries. The app for Android and iOS is available in 59 languages and among the Top #5 dating apps in many countries. We connect people. For fun. For love. For life.

Our company is bootstrapped and operated by just the two founders. We're not a start-up anymore, and we have proven that we built a sustainable business in a fast-growing, competitive and profitable sector.

The perks:

  • remote and flexible (work from anywhere within a timezone you choose)
  • 30 paid personal vacation days per year
  • only the best hardware and software (use what works best for you)
  • personal home office budget (2,000 € to buy what you need every 2 years)
  • make a difference (we're laser-focused and lean)

Benefits

Be our number 1 employee
Lean company - no bullshit
We work remote
Flexible schedules
Ability to work with cutting-edge technology
Competitive salary
You can make a difference
Paid time off

items.title: Data Engineer at Leadfeeder (Helsinki, Finland) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent

Job description

We are a fast-growing startup based in Helsinki determined to make Leadfeeder a big thing globally. We have a solid international business and our customers love what we do for them with Leadfeeder.

We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our team.

You can either be based in Helsinki, Finland or work remotely.

You would:

  • Think critically and engineer improvements to our data storage and processing
  • Develop and maintain our data warehouse (AWS Redshift) and data pipelining.
  • Build systems to improve our customers' data quality
  • Use data to help us and our customers make better decisions.
  • Visualize and explore processed data

Benefits


What we offer you:

  • Competitive base pay
  • Work remotely from wherever you like
  • An interesting and growing field of business
  • Great support from your new colleagues
  • The chance to work with cool and exciting technologies
  • A chance to be part of the next Finnish success story
  • Cool office in central Helsinki. Including bike storage.
  • Home Internet subscription
  • Fun events with the whole crew

About Leadfeeder

We are a fast growing startup based in Helsinki determined to make Leadfeeder a big thing globally.

items.title: Data Analyst (m/f) at komoot (Berlin, Germany) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Data Scientist
Industry: Cycling, Information Technology, Mobile Application
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help users all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, and we empower everybody to explore more of the great outdoors. To help us be even better at what we do, we’re looking for a data analyst to help us to drive product decisions and strategy. We believe that data-driven decision making is key to our success and your skills and curiosity will play a crucial role in building the future of outdoor experiences.

Your key responsibilities

  • Turn events and data into actionable insights
  • Develop analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
  • Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and continuous reports
  • Communicate and present findings to different audiences
  • Working closely with teams throughout the company, solving very diverse data challenges
  • Be an evangelist of data-driven decision-making

Why you will love it

  • You’ll be a key player in making product development, marketing and business decisions
  • You’ll work with a modern and powerful analytics platform based on AWS Kinesis and Redshift
  • You’ll work in a fast-paced startup with strongly motivated and talented co-workers
  • You’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want and work with whichever tools you love
  • We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, our headquarters in Potsdam or anywhere else that lies in any time zone between UTC-1 and UTC+3
  • Every day, your work will inspire people to discover more of the great outdoors
  • You’ll join us for team gatherings in locations like Mallorca or the Bavarian Alps several times a year

You will be successful in this position if you

  • Have a burning desire to transform data into actionable insights
  • Have 3+ years of relevant experience interpreting data
  • Have proven skills in programming (e.g. in python), SQL and Pandas/R
  • Have strong communication skills
  • Have fundamental statistical skills
  • Are keen to keep in touch with the latest advances in your area
  • Have a hands-on attitude and are highly self-driven

Sounds like you?

Then send us the following:

  • Your CV
  • A write-up explaining who you are and why you are interested in working at komoot
  • Examples of your work (e.g. GitHub, PDFs, Slideshare, etc.)
  • Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about what you’re interested in, be it your Twitter/Instagram account, or your OpenStreetMap profile if you have one
  • You’ll get bonus points for: Doing something creative with komoot (we love it when people go the extra mile)

About komoot

We Love What We Do

Komoot is the world’s leading outdoor app. We offer modern explorers best-in-class tech so that hikers and bikers have topographic maps, turn-by-turn navigation, recommendations on cool places and more at their fingertips.

The Freedom To Rock Your Craft

The world’s leading outdoor app, komoot hires the best folks to do what they love. Have a passion for the great outdoors and an ability to get things done? You might be the superstar we’re searching for.

Benefits

Work wherever you thrive
28 paid vacation days
Health insurance
Latest computers and devices

items.title: Front End Developer at High Growth Social Media Company (AI/machine learning) EU at BrandBastion () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Social Media
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Full-time remote position available only for candidates in the GMT to GMT+3 time zones.

BrandBastion is a rapidly growing company focused on disrupting the brand reputation and ad performance services on social media with the use of AI and machine learning. We work with Fortune 500 companies, governments, start-ups and non-profits in North America, South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. We are backed by great investors such as Mårten Mickos (HackerOne) and Risto Siilasmaa (founder of F-Secure).

We are scouting for a front end multi-talent to join our A-team full time:

You are passionate about designing, developing and implementing web interfaces and apps for next-gen services using frameworks such as React. You want to lead and drive change in your own area. You function best in a fast-paced environment with focus on execution. You are self-organized, self-motivated, a good communicator and you inspire others through your work.

You will:

  • Lead the front end side of our software projects
  • Be actively involved in architecting new services and products together with our core team
  • Will work on building single-page real time web applications with focus on performance, usability and user experience
  • Be proactive and up-to-date with the latest changes in the industry
  • Share our values: focus on execution, adaptability and agility, knowledge above hierarchy, self-drive and constant improvement.

Skills & Requirements

  • Experience with any of the following would be an asset: SaaS, CRM, real-time web applications, interactive dashboards
  • Extensive JavaScript knowledge (+3 years)
  • Working experience with React (+Redux), Angular (optional)
  • You like fast responsive interfaces and know how to optimize them
  • ES6, Node.js, NPM, CSS (SASS), D3.js
  • Data APIs, Websocket
  • Extensive testing and CI knowledge
  • UI/UX prototyping, usability, responsive design would be an asset
  • Good team communicator and collaborator with excellent English skills
  • Innovative and entrepreneurial mindset

About BrandBastion

BrandBastion is a growth company specialized in real time protection of brand reputation and ad performance on social media. We fight trolls and pirates on a daily basis and remove harmful user-generated content from our clients' social media properties within 8 minutes 24/7.

We work with governments and Fortune 500 companies in for example gaming, entertainment, e-commerce and technology.

We've developed a large scale web platform that handles large amounts of real time social media data (Facebook, Instagram and YouTube, etc.) incorporated with innovative technologies such as machine learning and AI to bring a new standard to online brand protection.

Benefits

Flexible working hours
5 star investors and advisors such as Marten Mickos and Risto Siilasma
Competitive compensation + possibility to acquire equity
Opportunities to travel
Awesome customers and great coworkers
5 weeks paid vacation

items.title: Senior Machine Learning Software Engineer at Stardog Union (Arlington, VA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Databases, Enterprise Software, Information Technology
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Stardog is the world's leading Knowledge Graph platform for the Enterprise. Turn data into knowledge faster and easier. Stardog lets you query, search, and analyze enterprise data, wherever it is, using scalable, cutting-edge Knowledge Graph technology.

We've been actively working on adding machine learning capabilities to Stardog, and are looking for someone to help us take it to the next level.


If you're interested in natural language processing, deep learning, probabilistic graphical models, and recommender systems, this might be the job you've been dreaming about!

Responsibilities

  • Research and develop algorithms to analyze large scale (un)structured data
  • Design and develop high-performance, data-driven components for our distributed database
  • Implement complex data ingestion pipelines
  • Deploy and operationalize machine learning models


Requirements:

  • 5+ years programming experience, ideally in Java
  • Strong computer science fundamentals, with advanced knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Experience on applying machine learning and natural language processing techniques to real world datasets
  • Interest in recent scientific developments, with an eye for practical applications
  • Knowledge of Vowpal Wabbit, Theano/Keras, GATE/UIMA, Lucene/ElasticSearch, and similar frameworks

About Stardog Union

Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Benefits

Health care including dental & vision, some plans fully company paid
401k
3 weeks vacation
Remote work available for qualified candidates
Top of the line hardware
Flexible work schedule
Company paid life and disability benefits
Well stocked kitchen, snacks, lunch, and most importantly, coffee

items.title: Data Engineer at Formstack (Indianapolis, IN) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Information Technology, SaaS, Web Technology
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Formstack, the most flexible and powerful form building application, is looking for a Data Engineer to add to its already awesome Dev team.

Formstack is an 11 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform.

What You Will Do:

This position will focus on creating, maintaining and optimizing the way we store data. You will work with and create APIs to digest data and store within a data warehouse. You will understand how multiple data points work together and how they should be stored. You will evaluate and create services to make reporting of data easy for your co-workers. We are a data driven company and you will own all the data points the company uses to make decisions. Needless to say, you like a challenge, complex problems and responsibility.

Who You Are:

You are a problem solver and are motivated to learn. You are a great communicator, collaborative, detail oriented and can see a project through from start to finish. You are able to make decisions on your own but know when to ask for help. You understand it takes a team to build something powerful and don't mind constructive feedback. You are familiar with big data storage and understand there are more ways to store things than just MySQL. You have experience in large scale data store projects and architecture and can bring some wisdom from previous projects.

Requirements

  • PHP with Unit Testing (PHPUnit)
  • Deep knowledge of SQL (MySQL and noSQL)
  • Git
  • Solid experience in at least one of the following
    • building micro services
    • high-use APIs
  • Ability to use command line tools
  • Ability to work remote and with remote team members
  • Excellent written and oral English communication skills
  • The ability to work independently but also work well within a team environment.
  • The ability to travel (<10%) for team meetups, conferences, etc.

Extra Credit Qualifications

  • Experience with AWS or comparable cloud-computing platform
  • Experience building large-scale high-performance systems
  • RJ Metrics or a similar service
  • Salesforce
  • Jupyter Notebooks experience
  • Data warehouse implementation experience

What Formstack Offers:

  • Remote environment
  • 100% Covered Medical, Dental, Vision as well as company-paid Disability and Life Insurance Benefits for full-time employees
  • 401k with matching company contribution for full-time employees
  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job
  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning
  • Yearly company gatherings
  • Unlimited PTO for all employees

Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Check out this Video and apply if you want to jump into the next great chapter of your life.

About Formstack

Formstack is an 11 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom

Benefits

The most up-to-date software
401k Safe Harbor Match
Lunch everyday paid for by Formstack (for employees in Indianapolis)
Generous PTO policy
Remote working office
All the snacks you can handle
Company-contributions to HSA
Monthly company "fun"
Yearly team-building event for the whole company
All the pings and pongs you can handle!

items.title: Principal Software Engineer - Big Data Performance at Carbon Black (Boulder, CO) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Cybersecurity, Information Technology
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: Private

Job description

The Principal Software Engineer - Big Data Performance will co-lead, define and build for performance and scale the next generation of endpoint security applications. This is more than a chance to write amazing code for something at significant scale with talented peers. It is a chance to have a huge impact on how hundreds of companies and governments visualize and neutralize threats to their networks. This is where global politics meet your code and the people who it empowers. Join us to make something that matters.

What You’ll Do

  • Design and optimize the performance of a backend data processing pipeline that is resilient to failures and is highly scalable.
  • Plan, monitor and improve the performance of a distributed application to process a lot of streaming data.
  • Review and guide development of Restful APIs to query terabytes of data.
  • Participate in all phases of the software development cycle as part of a Scrum team.
  • Proactively move the technology base to use latest tools and frameworks for best performance; considering costs and scale.
  • Collaborate with product management, DevOps, backend, and front-end engineers to deliver the right solution.
  • Support existing production code and improve performance enhancements and products.

What You’ll Bring

Principal Software Engineer - Big Data Performance, you’ll plan for high-performance computing, build and improve a highly scalable and reliable system to process and store terabytes of data.

  • 7-10 years of experience developing server side applications.
  • 2-4 years building high performing/data intensive applications running in the cloud.
  • Implement changes for performance, scalability and reliability
  • Experience with:
    • Java
    • Restful APIs
    • JMS, AMQP, SQS
    • Git
    • Scaling enterprise applications in the cloud
    • Reducing costs in production
    • Agile Software Development

Bonus Points:

  • B.S./M.S. in Computer Science or related degree
  • NoSQL technologies
  • AWS & Elastic Search
  • CI/CD pipeline

Why Carbon Black?

At Carbon Black, you’ll have the chance to make an impact in the ever-evolving cybersecurity space. Our advanced technology tackles even the toughest challenges and stays ahead of the latest threats.

If you want to join an agile company that’s building bleeding edge technology in the cloud, Carbon Black is the place for you. Driven by passionate people who are dedicated to making the world safer, it’s no wonder we’ve been named a “Top Place to Work” by the Boston Globe for three consecutive years. Join us!

About Carbon Black

Who We Are

Carbon Black is the leading provider of next-generation endpoint security. Carbon Black’s Next-Generation Antivirus (NGAV) solution, Cb Defense, leverages breakthrough prevention technology, “Streaming Prevention,” to instantly see and stop cyberattacks before they execute. Cb Defense uniquely combines breakthrough prevention with market-leading detection and response into a single, lightweight agent delivered through the cloud. With more than 7 million endpoints under management, Carbon Black has more than 2,500 customers, including 30 of the Fortune 100. These customers use Carbon Black to replace legacy antivirus, lock down critical systems, hunt threats, and protect their endpoints from the most advanced cyberattacks, including non-malware attacks.

Carbon Black, Inc. is an EEO/AA employer. Carbon Black is an inclusive employer that believes in workplace equality, supports diversity, creates a welcoming environment, and respects the unique qualities each individual brings to the company. 

Benefits

Flexible vacation
Remote/Work-from-home options
Medical/Dental/Vision
Stand-up desks and unique workspaces
Free snacks/drinks, Happy Hours, and regular catering
Care.com access and pet insurance
On-site gym
Career development programs
Lounge/game room
Competitive salaries, 401k, and stock options

items.title: Online Video Instructor for Java Frameworks Training at LinkedIn Learning at Lynda Teach (Carpinteria, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Online Education
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Public

Job description

Transform people's lives. Teach skills to create opportunity.  Apply to be a LinkedIn Learning/Lynda author today!

Please note that this is a contract-based course instructor role, not an in-house developer position.

At Lynda, we believe in connecting people to opportunity by sharing knowledge. With millions of members, your voice and expertise can make a difference.

Are you an experienced technology professional with a passion to teach and share your expertise? Do you thrive on taking the complex and making it simple? 'Is the "why" just as important as the "how" to you? If you have knowledge to share, let’s connect! We’re seeking backend developers to create video training courses for our rapidly-growing audience.

If you have a passion for and experience working with these Java Frameworks, let’s talk!

  • Java EE
  • JavaServer Faces (JSF) & PrimeFaces
  • Spring & Spring Boot
  • Play!
  • DropWizard
  • Netty

As a Linkedin Learning/Lynda instructor, you get more than a platform - you get a partner. We pride ourselves on producing the highest quality educational courses available. You’ll partner with content area experts to scope and refine your ideas, then work with a professional production team of instructional designers, producers, graphic designers, editors, and QA specialists to assemble your world-class technology training course. Our well-established production process allows you to spend more time creating course content, while we take the lead on designing, producing, and editing the course. Ready to get started?

Join our passionate and experienced team of educators and technologists!

Note: we are always looking for new authors across the technology spectrum; even if you do not see your technical expertise listed, please inquire and clearly list your topics of expertise/interest. 

Skills & Requirements

  • Deep knowledge of, and professional experience with, the technologies you wish to teach
  • Prior teaching experience preferred, but not required
  • Involvement with the Java developer ecosystem and community preferred
  • Interest in e-learning as a medium, either as a trainer or student
  • Ability to respond to and incorporate feedback productively
  • Ability to commit approximately 30 hours to developing a course (over several months) and 1-week to record in one of our studios (travel expenses paid). Remote recording options available.

Steps to Becoming a Lynda Author

  1. Speak to one of our Content Managers about your background, our process and course ideas.
  2. Work with your Content Manager to put together a short (3-5 minute), un-edited sample movie.  
  3. Work on a Table of Contents and Course Description with your Content Manager.
  4. Set schedule & work with a Producer to build out course materials--scripts, slides and technical demos, as appropriate.
  5. Fly out to one of our studios to record your course, with guidance from your Producer in the recording booth.
  6. Help resolve any bugs found in editing, post-production and quality assurance stages (usually <1 hour of work on author’s part).

About Lynda Teach

LinkedIn Learning/Lynda is the leading online learning platform that helps anyone learn software, technology, business, and creative skills to achieve personal and professional goals. Through individual, corporate, academic and government subscriptions, members have access to the video library of engaging, top-quality courses taught by recognized industry experts.

For 20 years, we've helped students, leaders, IT and design pros, project managers—anyone in any role—build software, creative, and business skills. Now part of Linkedin Learning, Lynda serves more than 10,000 organizations. With tutorials in five languages, Lynda is a global platform for success.

Benefits

Earn advances and royalties
Work remotely
Work part time
Join a supportive and cohesive team
Work freelance
Give back to your community
Get full editing and graphics support

items.title: Back End Data Engineer at Clevertech () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Back End Data Engineer to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this for sixteen years, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.

This role has database design and implementation responsibilities including alternative data structures such as nosql, redis, elastic search and more. 

---

REQUIREMENTS:

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

Technically, you have 3 years experience in with complex data structures.

Well qualified applicants will have deep experience in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You will have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities by their success and technical depth.

About Clevertech

BENEFITS

OWN YOUR TIME

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

FOCUSED WORK

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

LEARN AT YOUR EDGES

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

RECHARGE TIME

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

Benefits

Full-Time Telecommuting
Flexible Schedules
Paid Time Off
Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
Contribute to Open Source

items.title: Machine Learning Software Engineer @ Stardog
items.content:
Machine Learning Software Engineer @ Stardog

2017-11-03 02:13

Description

Stardog is the world's leading Knowledge Graph platform for the Enterprise. Turn data into knowledge faster and easier. Stardog lets you query, search, and analyze enterprise data, wherever it is, using scalable, cutting-edge Knowledge Graph technology.

We've been actively working on adding machine learning capabilities to Stardog, and are looking for someone to help us take it to the next level.If you're interested in natural language processing, deep learning, probabilistic graphical models, and recommender systems, this might be the job you've been dreaming about!

Responsibilities

  • Research and develop algorithms to analyze large scale (un)structured data
  • Design and develop high-performance, data-driven components for our distributed database
  • Implement complex data ingestion pipelines
  • Deploy and operationalize machine learning models

Requirements:

  • 5+ years programming experience, ideally in Java
  • Strong computer science fundamentals, with advanced knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Experience on applying machine learning and natural language processing techniques to real world datasets
  • Interest in recent scientific developments, with an eye for practical applications
  • Knowledge of Vowpal Wabbit, Theano/Keras, GATE/UIMA, Lucene/ElasticSearch, and similar frameworks
  • Ability to work in a distributed team mainly communicating over email, chat, and phone
  • Experience with graph technologies or databases is a plus

We have offices in Arlington, VA and Boston, MA. Remote working is also possible for qualified candidates.

Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins.

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Senior Distributed Database Engineer @ Stardog
items.content:
Senior Distributed Database Engineer @ Stardog

2017-11-03 02:11

Description

Stardog is the world's leading Knowledge Graph platform for the Enterprise. Turn data into knowledge faster and easier. Stardog lets you query, search, and analyze enterprise data, wherever it is, using scalable, cutting-edge Knowledge Graph technology.

The future has always been distributed and the future is arriving now. If you know that Raft isn't just a flotation device, then you could be a great fit for Stardog.

Responsibilities:

  • Help design and build distributed storage and query evaluation over a large database cluster
  • Develop and implement algorithms for distributed transactions over very large clusters
  • Implement and optimize graph algorithms over distributed indexes
  • Work on integration with DCOS frameworks like Mesos

Requirements:

  • 5+ years programming experience, ideally in Java
  • Strong computer science fundamentals, with advanced knowledge of data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Experience building distributed databases, systems, and service-oriented architectures
  • Knowledge of Spark, Storm, Flink, DCOS frameworks like Mesos
  • Ability to work in a distributed team mainly communicating over email, chat, and phone
  • Experience with graph technologies or databases is a plus

We have offices in Arlington, VA and Boston, MA. Remote working is also possible for qualified candidates.

Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins.

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Data Scientist/ Machine Learning Architect
items.content:
About you

If you care about software quality but find testing and QA boring, as someone with machine learning expertise, you may have always thought "there must be a better way"!
Do you love building new stuff, learning and working with emerging technologies, alongside a team of skilled engineers with the same passion as yours? Driven to build a unique and groundbreaking product? Want to work on something that has not been done before?
If so, we would like to hear from you.


About us

We are SpotQA's Product Team, building the next generation of testing automation software.
We are building the self-driving car technology for the testing world.
Our objective? To develop new technology using machine-learning and domain expertise with the aim of performing testing fully autonomously
To help with our mission, we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with machine learning expertise to join our team


REQUIREMENTS

Since we're building emerging technology, we're looking for solid engineering skills and experience, with solid knowledge of the theoretical fundamentals. Most importantly, we are looking for can-do attitudes, a passion to learn/grow independently and willingness to delve into problems.

We have our eyes on a few skills, namely:

Strong practical experience and theoretical background in machine learning.
Strong programming skills in at least one major programming language (e.g., Java, C++, Python)
A postgraduate degree (preferably PhD) in a relevant machine learning topic is desirable.
Ability to apply cross-domain knowledge to solve new machine-learning problems, and able to create/apply a multitude of ML solutions to solve a problem from different angles.
Can demonstrate expertise in neural networks/deep-learning techniques, RNNs, CNNs, LSTMs.
Polyglot: can program effectively in a wide range of programming languages and frameworks.


BENEFITS

Competitive Salary.
Possibility of working remotely is available.
Personal development by working with a fast growing multinational startup aiming to shape the future of Digital QA.
